metadata.title: curl: information disclosure by exploiting a mixed case flaw (moderate)
metadata.description: DOCUMENTATION: The MITRE CVE dictionary describes this issue as: This flaw allows a malicious HTTP server to set "super cookies" in curl that are then passed back to more origins than what is otherwise allowed or possible. This allows a site to set cookies that then would get sent to different and unrelated sites and domains. It could do this by exploiting a mixed case flaw in curl's function that verifies a given cookie domain against the Public Suffix List (PSL). For example a cookie could be set with `domain=co.UK` when the URL used a lower case hostname `curl.co.uk`, even though `co.uk` is listed as a PSL domain.

criterions.comment: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 is installed
puppet-agent is signed with Red Hat redhatrelease2 key
Red Hat Enterprise Linux must be installed
